lines.text: My dear, uncooperative Domino.
How do you know that? How do you know my friends call me Domino?
It's on the bracelet on your ankle.
So... what sharp little eyes you've got.
Wait 'til you get to my teeth.
[Placing Fiona's body in a chair after she is shot on the dance floor]
Do you mind if my friend sits this one out? She's just dead.
Funny-looking bruise. A fall?
A poker, in the hands of a widow.
Really? I'd have thought you were just the type for a widow.
Not this one. He didn't like me at all.

[after Bond finds her in the bathtub in his hotel room]
Since you're here, would you mind giving me something to put on?
[Bond casually hands Fiona her shoes]
[after shooting Vargas with a spear gun]
I think he got the point.
Some men just don't like to be driven.
No, some men don't like to be taken for a ride.
[after making love to the evil Fiona Volpe]
My dear girl, don't flatter yourself. What I did this evening was for Queen and country. You don't think it gave me any pleasure, do you?

But of course, I forgot your ego, Mr. Bond. James Bond, the one where he has to make love to a woman, and she starts to hear heavenly choirs singing. She repents, and turns to the side of right and virtue...
[she steps on Bond's foot]
... but not this one!
Of course. Vargas does not drink... does not smoke... does not make love. What do you do, Vargas?
[to the shark that almost bit him]
You can tell of the one that got away.
It looks very difficult.
[Shooting from the hip, Bond shatters his clay pigeon]
Why no, it isn't, is it!
[after making love to Pat, Bond sees something suspicious on the grounds, and gets up to investigate]
James, where are you going?
Oh, nowhere. I just thought I'd take a little, uh... exercise.
You must be joking.
It is to be handled with special care!
Everything you give me...
...is treated with equal contempt. Yes, I know.
[Largo dies]
I'm glad I killed him.
*You're* glad?
In the conference room - something pretty big; every double-o man in Europe has been rushed in. And the Home Secretary, too!
His wife probably lost her dog.
[after leaving an Irrigation Therapy Room]
See you later, irrigator.
Try to be a little less than your frivolous self, 007.

[draping arm around nurse]
Do I seem healthy to you?
Too healthy, by far.
Well, hello Double-Oh...
[James slugs Felix to shut him up, then slugs the bad guy hiding in the shower]
Fine way to treat the CIA!
I'm sorry about that, Felix, but you were about to say double-O seven. Here.
[James gives Felix the bad guy's gun]
Well, James, did you kill him?
You know me better than that.
That gun, it looks more fitting for a woman.
You know much about guns, Mr. Bond?
No, but I know a little about women.
[Bond and Largo spot Domino eavesdropping]
I hope we didn't scare the fishes.

[threatening Domino with a cigarette and ice cubes]
This for heat, these for cold, applied scientifically and slowly.
James, how else will you recognize her?
Can't miss. She has two moles on her left thigh.
[after strapping Bond to the motorized traction table]
There, first time I've felt safe all day.
[Bond is standing in the doorway between their apartments as Fiona takes a bath]
Aren't you in the wrong room, Mr. Bond?
Not from where I'm standing.

[massaging Pat]
Mink. It uh, reduces the tensions.

[throaty voice]
Not mine.
SPECTRE is a dedicated fraternity whose strength lies in the absolute integrity of its members.

[donning the underwater jet pack]
... and the kitchen sink.
On you, anything looks good.
Every man has his passion - mine is fishing. What is yours, Mr. Bond?
Well... I'm not what you'd call a passionate man.
What exactly do you do?
Oh, I travel... a sort of licensed troubleshooter.
[after a narrow escape from a motorized traction table set on overload]
I must be six inches taller.
I've assigned you to Station "C" Canada.
Sir, I'd respectfully request that you change my assignment to Nassau.
Is there any other reason, besides your enthusiasm for water sports?
[Bond shows M a picture of Dominique Derval, the Vulcan pilot's sister]
Do we know where she is now?
Nassau.
Do you think she's worth going after?
Well, I wouldn't put it quite like that, sir...
What's our next move?
The Disco Volante. If the bombs aren't aboard, they soon will be.
Who you going to ask, Largo?
No, we won't have to.
You wish to put the evil eye on me, eh? We have a way to deal with that where I come from.
You may hex me. Let's see what it does for the cards.
[first lines]
J.B.
At the moment, rather him than me.
At least you've been saved the effort of removing him. Colonel Bouvar passed away in his sleep, so they tell me.
Mm...
You sound disappointed you did not kill him yourself.
I am. Jacques Bouvar murdered two of my colleagues.
[last lines]

[helping Domino into a life raft]
Up.
Lets get back and tell Largo.
Keep in touch.
Anytime, anyplace, James.
Another time, another place.

[after Bond slides a broom handle through the handles of doors on a sitting steam bath that Lippe is in]
What the hell do you think you're doing?
Now don't you worry, I'll tell the chef!
Let me out of this bloody machine!
Like your friend you've been a little too clever, and now you are caught!

[Loud and firm as Bond, who is late, is the last agent to take a seat in the conference room]
Now that we're ALL here...
Well, we have exactly 14 hours and 50 minutes - and then I suppose we shall have to pay up and look as happy as we can - shan't we?

[Talking on the phone]
Moneypenny, next time I see you, I'll put you across my knee.
On yogurt and lemon juice? Ha-ha. I can hardly wait!
Take off your bath robe, please.
You never say that as if you meant it.
Arms above your head, please.
[Bond makes a pass]
Behave yourself, Mr. Bond!
You better come along with with me. Spend a few minutes in the steam room. That will help to relax you.
Yes.
Might even shrink you back to size.
You wouldn't tell Doctor Wade? Please, I'd lose my job.
Well, I, I suppose my silence could have a price.
You don't mean - oh, no.
Oh, yes!

Thunderball. As you can see, we have very little to go on. All the members of the crew had top security clearance. You'll find their photographs and service records in your files. You'll be working with NATO, CIA and all allied intelligence units. Well, that's all - until you've discussed your individual assignments with me.

[Looking at a photograph]
A smashing figure! I don't suppose that has anything to do with your request.
Was there ever a man more misunderstood.
Now, James, you can't pull the wool over my eyes. You may be able to con the old man, but, I know better.
I've been admiring your form.
Have you now? You're name's James Bond and you've been admiring my form?
Most girls just paddle around. You swim like a man.
So do you.
Have some of my conch chowder.
You've been reading the wrong books, Mr. Bond.
About conch chowder?
About being an aphrodisiac.
Well, it just so happens that I like conch chowder.
Oh!
Someone has to lose.
Yes, I thought I saw a spectre at your shoulder.
What do you mean?
The spectre of defeat. That your luck was due to change.
We'll soon find out.

[Ordering at Cafe Martinique]
Beluga caviar, Dom Perignon '55.
I understand you're Mr. Largo's niece?
Sounds better than - what would you say? Mistress? Kept woman?

[Sarcastically]
What a wonderful surprise.
Well, for me too. I must say, I find this business of equipping you in the field, on the run, as it were, highly irregular. Here we have a geiger counter...
It closes to a convenient pocket size.
Assuming one has a convenient pocket.
How far do you go?
You better fasten your safety belt.
You would like Bond dead.
I can think of no better arrangement.
Is it because he tries to make love to your woman?
Because he is Bond and is an enemy of SPECTRE - he should be killed.
Rum Collins, Mr. Bond?
Yes.
Do you like wild things, Mr. Bond, James Bond?
Wild? You should be locked up in a cage.
Mmm. I mean this bed feels like a cage. All these bars. Do you think I'll be - safe?

[to Bond after a lovemaking session]
You made a shocking mess out of my hair, you sadistic brute. Will you zip me up, please?
Domino, I need your help.
Of course, that's why you made love to me.
